message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the human senses. Option (A) is correct because you can hear a sound produced by an electric viola. Option (B) is incorrect because perfume is a scent and cannot be heard. Option (C) is incorrect because thoughts are mental processes and cannot be heard. Option (D) is incorrect because a prism is an object and does not produce sound.

This question requires knowledge about the human sense of hearing. The correct answer is (A) because an electric viola produces sound waves that can be heard by the human ear. Option (B) is incorrect because perfume is a scent and cannot be heard. Option (C) is incorrect because thoughts are mental processes and cannot be heard. Option (D) is incorrect because a prism is a physical object and does not produce sound.

Option (A) is correct because an electric viola produces sound when it is played. Option (B) is incorrect because perfumes do not produce sound. Option (C) is incorrect because thoughts are not physical entities that can produce sound waves. Option (D) is incorrect because a prism is an object that does not produce sound.
